title.narrative: Stöd till lokala skogs befolkningars anpassning till klimatförändringar
UICN Burkina /Adaptation of local forest populations to climate change 2016-2018

description.narrative:
IUCN har begärt finansiellt stöd om 22 MSEK från Sida för att genomföra projektet "Support to local forest populations' adaptation fo climate change" under perioden 15 november 2016 - 31 december 2018. Projektets syfte är att skapa ekologiska och socio-ekonomiska förutsättningar för stärkt kapacitet för anpassning till klimatförändringar hos den sårbara befolkningen i två regioner i Burkina Faso. Projektet avser att färdigställa och tillämpa instrument för decentraliserad skogsförvaltning i skogarna Sablogo respektive Soudougui samt i 12 agro-forestry-områden. Projektet förväntas stärka motståndskraften mot klimatförändringar hos den övervägande del av lokalbefolkningen som är beroende av skog och skogsprodukter. IUCN är genomförare av projektet i samarbete med miljöministeriets regionala direktorat i Centre-East resp Centre-West -regionerna, berörda kommuner (Bissiga, Cassou, Lalgaye, Soudougui, Tenkodogo) samt lokala organisationer. Budgeten uppgår till 22 MSEK varav cirka 53% avses att vidareförmedlas till nationella partners. ----------------------------- IUCN has applied to Sida for funding of 22 million SEK to carry out the project "Support to local forest populations' adaptation fo climate change" during the period 15 november 2016 to December 2018.
The overall objective of the project is to create ecological and socio-economic conditions to support the adaptive capacity to climate change of the riparian vulnerable communities in two regions of Burkina Faso. Specifically, it will finalize the development and implementation of decentralized management tools of the forests of Sablogo and Soudougui and 12 parklands; The expected impact is the Reduction of the vulnerability for climate change of local populations depending on forests. IUCN will implement the intervention together with the Regional offices (Centre East and Centre West) of the ministry of environment, green economy and climate change (MEEVCC), the concerned communes (Bissiga, Cassou, Lalgaye, Soudougui, Tenkodogo) and non-governmental partner organisations. The intervention’s total budget is 22 million SEK. Approximately 53% of the intervention budget will be forwarded from IUCN to the implementing partners.
Improve economic and socio ecological bases of community forest sustainability for climate adaptation

The overall objective of the project is to contribute to creating ecological and socio-economic conditions favorable to the adaptation to climate change of vulnerable populations living in the community forests of the central west and central east regions of Burkina Faso. The specific objectives are: - to increase decentralized forest governance effectiveness in the Center East and Center East regions - to skill, knowledge and/or equipment for the sustainable management of agrosilvopastoral and forest productions provided to three categories of actors in 5 intervention communes - to strengthen socio-economic and ecological sustainability of forests and their areas of influence - to increase carbon sequestration capacity by the target forests and agro-forest areas.

participating-org.narrative: Sida administrative activity implemented by procured partner

tag.narrative: 1.5 - By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters.

1.5 - Till 2030 bygga upp motståndskraften hos de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer och minska deras utsatthet och sårbarhet för extrema klimatrelaterade händelser och andra ekonomiska, sociala och miljömässiga chocker och katastrofer.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Examples of Results that have been achieved, both expected and unexpected Expected Results of the project - The PACOF-CC made it possible to sensitize local communities bordering the targeted forest massifs and fostered a symbiosis between these populations and their forests. - Local elected officials were well equipped on forest governance. -The production capacities of shea butter producers were increased. - Forest management groups and cooperative were equipped with new forest restoration techniques for better adaptation to climate change. UNEXPECTED RESULTS - Increased financial resource mobilization capacities of 2 relay organizations (CODD-Burkina and Bissakoupou). Having made significant funds available to relay organizations to support producers and trained them in financial management has made them more reliable for other partners who are entrusting them with more projects to be implemented to manage other funds dedicated to grassroots community organizations. - Increased financial resource mobilization capacities of Silly Commune butter producers. The fact of having supported the women producers of shea butter in Silly commune, in the professionalization of their production by acquisition of suitable materials and equipment has encouraged increase of their production, opening them at high markets of range. They have thus succeeded in mobilizing additional funding from other institutions. - Distinction of Bissiga municipality as the best municipality of the year 2019. Efforts of good governance of the forest massifs were recognized by the Head of State who awarded the first prize for the best municipality in environmental matters to Bissiga municipality during the first edition of the National Tree Day organized in 2019. - Improving municipal self-financing capacities in the field of conservation Silly Commune, and all the other four communes, had benefited from a technical assistant on behalf of the project to facilitate project actions. At the end of its mandate, Silly commune maintained its assistant, whose support enabled the commune to mobilize funding from other financial partners for actions in the field of natural resource conservation.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
